references.paper_title: High-dimensional dynamics of generalization error in neural networks
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for understanding the dynamics of generalization error in high-dimensional neural networks, which is crucial for understanding and improving the efficiency of self-supervised learning.
This paper offers a comprehensive overview of self-supervised learning methods, providing practical guidelines for implementing and evaluating different SSL frameworks.

references.paper_title: VICReg: Variance-invariance-covariance regularization for self-supervised learning
references.reason: This paper introduces VICReg, a novel non-contrastive self-supervised learning algorithm that improves upon existing methods by using variance-invariance-covariance regularization.

references.paper_title: Provable guarantees for self-supervised deep learning with spectral contrastive loss
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical guarantees for the performance of self-supervised deep learning methods that use a spectral contrastive loss, helping to bridge the gap between theory and practice in SSL.

references.paper_title: A simple framework for contrastive learning of visual representations
references.reason: This paper introduces SimCLR, a simple yet effective contrastive self-supervised learning framework that has significantly advanced the field of visual representation learning.
